revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=September 2015}} {{Infobox YouTube personality | name = Mamrie Hart | image = Mamrie Hart at No Filter.jpg | caption = Hart at the ''#NoFilter'' show in [[Portland, Oregon]], December 2013. | channel_name = YouDeserveADrink | views = 90+ million views | view_date = July 2018 | birth_name = Mamrie Lillian Hart | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1983|9|22}} | birth_place = [[Andover, New Jersey]] | nationality = [[United States|American]] | residence = [[Los Angeles, California]] | module = {{Infobox person | child = yes | alma_mater = [[University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill]] ([[Bachelor of Arts|BA]]) }} | occupation = Internet personality, comedian, actress, and author | years_active = 2009–present | genre = [[Comedy]] | subscribers = 1.1M+ Subscribers | network = [[ProSiebenSat.1 Media|Studio71]] | associated_acts = {{flatlist| * [[Grace Helbig]] * [[Hannah Hart]] }} | subscriber_date = July 2018 | silver_year = 2013 | gold_year = 2015 | stats_update = 27 July 2018 | silver_button = yes | gold_button = yes }} '''Mamrie Lillian Hart''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|m|eɪ|m|r|i}}; born September 22, 1983) is an [[United States|American]] comedian, actress, writer and performer.{{cite web|url=http://newyork.ucbtheatre.com/talent/view/10921 |title=UCB Theatre • Mamrie Hart |publisher=Newyork.ucbtheatre.com |date= |accessdate=September 17, 2013}} She gained popularity in 2011 through her [[YouTube]] show ''You Deserve A Drink,'' for which she won a [[Streamy Award]] in 2014 for Actress in a Comedy, in 2015 for Writing (Craft Award).{{Cite web|url = http://www.streamys.org/nominees-winners/4th-annual-nominees-winners/|title = 4th Annual Nominees|date = |accessdate = January 10, 2014|website = The Streamy Awards|publisher = |last = |first = }}{{Cite web|url = http://www.streamys.org/nominees-winners/5th-annual-nominees-winners/|title = 5th Annual Nominees|date = |accessdate = April 24, 2016|website = The Streamy Awards|publisher = |last = |first = }} and in 2017 for Acting In a Comedy. As of May 2018, she has over 1.2 million YouTube subscribers and her main channel has over 77.9 million views. She also co-wrote, co-produced and co-starred in the 2014 film ''[[Camp Takota]]'' and the 2016 film ''[[Dirty 30 (film)|Dirty 30]]''. ==Personal life== Hart was born in New Jersey and went to high school in [[Boonville, North Carolina]]. Her father is actor [[David Hart (actor)|David Hart]] and her mother, Caroline Mayhall, is a high school English teacher. She has a brother named David and a sister named Annie.{{cite web|url=http://mamrie.wordpress.com/2009/03/30/sistas-are-doing-it-for-themselves/ |title=sistas are doing it for themselves! | Mamrie's Weblog |publisher=Mamrie.wordpress.com |date=March 30, 2009 |accessdate=September 17, 2013}} Her parents divorced when she was nine years old.{{cite web |url=http://www.thevideoink.com/breaking-news/mamrie-hart-bring-boozy-memoir-deserve-drink-fans-2015-exclusive/ |title=Exclusive: Mamrie Hart to Bring Boozy Memoir ‘You Deserve a Drink’ to Fans in 2015 |date=January 21, 2014 |last=Patel |first=Sahil |work=Video Ink |accessdate=March 29, 2014}} Hart's first name is a tribute to her great grandmother, Lillian Mamrie. Hart earned her [[Bachelor of Arts]] in theater from [[UNC-Chapel Hill]]. Upon graduation, she moved to [[New York City]] to pursue "serious acting."{{cite web|last=O'Keefe|first=Meghan|title=Inside With: Steve Soroka and Mamrie Hart of BoF|url=http://www.theapiary.org/the-apiary/2011/3/31/inside-with-steve-soroka-mamrie-hart-of-bf.html|publisher=The Apiary|accessdate=May 22, 2013}} ==Career== ===Cudzoo and the Faggettes=== Cudzoo and the Faggettes{{cite web|title=Cudzoo and the Faggettes home page|url=http://www.cudzooandthefaggettes.com/|accessdate=May 22, 2013}} is a band known for its humorous, [[innuendo]]-laden lyrical content and live shows.{{cite web|last=Matthews|first=Cameron|title=Cudzoo and the Faggettes Own Their Crazy With 'Daddy Issues'|url=http://www.spinner.com/2012/02/06/cudzoo-faggettes-daddy-issues/|accessdate=May 24, 2013}} Mamrie 'Mametown' Hart joined forces with Erin 'E-Bomb' McCarson and Jessica 'J-Train' Bartley and formed a band called Cudzoo & the Faggettes. They came up with Cudzoo in reference to the Kudzu vines that are prevalent in the South where all three women came from."[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y8ZyT3fH8mI In Bed With Joan – Episode 58: Mamrie Hart]". YouTube. 2014-05-20. Retrieved 2014-10-01 They refer to their own style as a mixture between dirty doo wop and vintage rock. They often perform in New York, although the band is currently on a hiatus because Hart is residing in Los Angeles for the time being. They have released two albums, The Prettiest Girls With The Filthiest Mouths (2009) and Daddy Issues (2012).{{cite web|title=Cudzoo & the Faggettes|url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/cudzoo-the-faggettes-mn0002855909|publisher=AllMusic.com|accessdate=May 29, 2013}} The most notable singles are "Daddy Issues" and "New York Girls". ===YouTube=== Hart joined [[YouTube]] on June 20, 2009. She began her main channel, ''You Deserve A Drink'' (YDAD), on March 13, 2011, where she primarily posts weekly instructional [[cocktail|mixology]] videos, with a unique cocktail presented in each, allowing her to combine her past work experience as a bartender with performing.{{cite web|last=Main|first=Sami|title=Had A Hard Day? YouTube's Mamrie Hart Believes 'You Deserve A Drink'|url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/samimain/had-a-hard-day-youtubes-mamrie-hart-believes-yo-5pfv|publisher=Buzzfeed|accessdate=May 22, 2013}} The videos contain [[popular culture|pop culture]] references, sexual innuendo and numerous [[pun]]s, and occasionally she makes drinks for celebrities that she feels deserve a drink.{{cite web|last=Brogan |first=Taylor |title=A Mamrie After My Own Hart |url=http://inconnumag.com/2013/04/22/a-mamrie-after-my-own-hart/ |accessdate=May 22, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130926165746/http://inconnumag.com/2013/04/22/a-mamrie-after-my-own-hart/ |archivedate=September 26, 2013 |df= }} Once the drink is finished, Hart encourages viewers to make the cocktail themselves and then rewatch the video, using it as a [[drinking game]] wherein the participant takes a drink each time she makes a pun. Her favorite drink is a gin gimlet, straight up.{{citation needed|date=May 2016}} [[File:Grace Helbig, Hannah Hart, and Mamrie Hart at No Filter in December 2013.jpg|thumb|left|[[Grace Helbig]] and [[Hannah Hart]] (who has no relation to Mamrie) onstage with Mamrie at ''No Filter'' in [[Portland, Oregon]], in December 2013]] Hart periodically collaborates with other YouTube personalities, such as [[Grace Helbig]], [[Tyler Oakley]], [[Hannah Hart]] (no relation), and [[Flula Borg]]. She has also performed in videos by other YouTube entities like [[Rainn Wilson|Rainn Wilson's]] [[Soul Pancake]],{{cite web|title=Family Business – The Flipside|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oNnb5D8PREs|publisher=SoulPancake|accessdate=May 24, 2013}} stars in Sing-A-Gram on [[My Damn Channel]],{{cite web|title=Sing-A-Gram|url=https://www.youtube.com/show/singagram|publisher=My Damn Channel|accessdate=May 24, 2013}} and Multi-break Up with [[The Fine Brothers]]."MULTI-BREAK UP! (Last Moments of Relationships #18)". YouTube. 2014-08-26. Retrieved 2014-10-01 On May 7, 2013, Hart introduced her second YouTube channel, Mametown, on her [[Tumblr]] page. Prior to this, the account did not contain any videos despite being created in 2009. Hart aims to upload videos unrelated to YDAD. She initially requested viewers to recommend what she should post on the channel.{{cite web|last=Hart|first=Mamrie|title=May 7, 2013|url=http://mamrie.tumblr.com/post/49862292569/neenjacam-have-you-subscribed-to-mametown|publisher=Tumblr|accessdate=May 24, 2013}} Since then she has uploaded many unique videos that range from wacky characters, to introducing her dog Beanz Hart, to vlogging.{{Cite web|url = https://www.youtube.com/user/mametown|title = Mametown|date = |accessdate = January 10, 2014|website = Youtube|publisher = |last = |first = }} On July 1, 2014, Hart and [[Grace Helbig]] premiered footage of their travel web show #HeyUSA on the YouTube channel Astronauts Wanted.{{Cite web|url = http://mashable.com/2014/06/26/grace-helbig-mamrie-hart-youtube-heyusa/|title = YouTube Stars Take Summer Road Trip Guided by Fans|date = June 26, 2014|accessdate = April 9, 2015|website = Mashable|publisher = |last = Josh|first = Dickey}} On October 15, 2014 eight full-length episodes were posted to Conde Nast Entertainment's digital platform The Scene. A second season of #HeyUSA was released April 16, 2015, this time with special guest hosts instead of Grace Helbig. Viewers selected the following cohosts: [[Colleen Ballinger]], [[Flula Borg]], [[Kingsley (YouTube)|Kingsley]], [[Jenna Marbles]], and [[Tyler Oakley]]. Helbig selected the location to which Hart and her co-host traveled for each episode.{{Cite web|url = https://variety.com/2015/digital/news/youtube-star-mamrie-hart-hits-road-again-in-heyusa-travel-show-for-conde-nast-1201457092/|title = YouTube Star Mamrie Hart Hits Road Again in 'HeyUSA' Travel Show for Condé Nast|date = March 20, 2015|accessdate = April 9, 2015|website = |publisher = Variety|last = Spangler|first = Todd}} [[File:Mamrie Hart Vlogbrothers 2016.jpg|200x200px|thumb|Hart appearing in a [[Vlogbrothers]] video in 2016.]] On May 18, 2016, Hart guest starred in season 5 of the YouTube series [[Epic Rap Battles of History]], playing the role of [[Julia Child]] and rapping opposite [[Lloyd Ahlquist]], playing the role of [[Gordon Ramsay]]. Starting in March 2018, Hart and [[Grace Helbig]] began hosting a new YouTube show together called ''This Might Get...''{{cite web |url=https://variety.com/2018/digital/news/grace-helbig-mamrie-hart-youtube-daily-show-this-might-get-1202716549/ |title=Grace Helbig, Mamrie Hart on Their YouTube Talk Show: Pee-wee Herman Meets Hoda & Kathie Lee |last=Spangler |first=Todd |date=March 5, 2018 |website=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |publisher= |access-date=June 16, 2018 |quote=}} on a dedicated channel of the same name. Each episode has a different title, with the premiere being called "This Might Get Started," and focuses on a different topic, [[meme]], or pop culture event. It is executive produced by Michael Goldfine, who worked with the on-screen duo on ''Camp Takota'' and ''Dirty 30''. As of June 15, 2018, the duo have hosted 75 episodes of ''This Might Get...'' with their [[Father's Day]]-themed episode, "This Might Get Pop'd". They published their 100th episode on July 20, 2018, entitled "Making Slime Fail!". ===Upright Citizens Brigade=== Hart wrote and performed sketches with the [[Upright Citizens Brigade]] at the [[Chelsea, Manhattan|Chelsea]] location in [[New York City]], both live and in online shorts.{{cite web|title=UCBcomedy.com Performers: Mamrie Hart|url=http://newyork.ucbtheatre.com/talent/view/10921|accessdate=May 22, 2013}} One recurring collaboration with Stephen Soroka under the title BOF (short for best of friends, pronounced "boaf"){{cite web|title=BoF: It's Pronounced Boaf!|url=http://newyork.ucbtheatre.com/shows/view/2595|accessdate=May 22, 2013}} was nominated for Best Sketch Group at the 2010 and 2011 [[ECNY Awards]].{{cite web|title=UCBcomedy.com Talent: Mamrie Hart|url=http://www.ucbcomedy.com/talent/view/1439/mamrie-hart|accessdate=May 22, 2013}} She also wrote and starred with fellow alums Gabe Liedman and Jim Santangeli on the [[Cooking Channel|Cooking Channel's]] online sketch comedy show, ''Fodder''.{{cite web|last=Martineau|first=Chantal|title=Fodder Takes the Piss out of Foodie-Ism|url=http://www.foodrepublic.com/2012/04/24/fodder-takes-piss-out-foodie-ism|publisher=Food Republic|accessdate=May 22, 2013}} ===#NoFilter=== In 2012, Grace Helbig, Hannah Hart, and Mamrie Hart put together a live variety show which they named [[NoFilter|#NoFilter]] with comedy sketches, improv, giveaways and songs. In contrast with many live performances, they encourage documentation of the show by the audience.{{cite web|title=With 'Daily Grace' videos, comedian builds fan base|url=https://www.bostonglobe.com/arts/2013/05/23/with-daily-grace-videos-comedian-grace-helbig-builds-fan-base-online/ntPCVNQ4X4WG0SrkjFNCvK/story.html|publisher=Boston Globe|accessdate=May 24, 2013|author=Nick Zaino|date=May 23, 2013|quote=subscription required}} They have also re-enacted [[fan fiction]] written by Tumblr users which includes all three women. She also appeared in a similar series of sketches called FANtasies that adapted a soap opera style. The premiere was called "Paging Dr. Hart".{{Cite news|url=https://variety.com/2017/digital/news/fullscreen-wattpad-fanfiction-mamrie-hart-1202444095/|title=YouTube Stars, Wattpad Stories Tapped for Fullscreen's Fan-Fiction Anthology Series|last=Spangler|first=Todd|date=2017-05-25|work=Variety|access-date=2018-02-21|language=en-US}} ===TV and film=== Mamrie has appeared in several [[television commercials]], including a campaign for [[La-Z-Boy]] featuring [[Brooke Shields]].{{cite web|title=Neighbor|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FemyNsYOhko|accessdate=May 22, 2013}} She appeared in an episode of ''[[Don't Trust the B---- in Apartment 23]]'' in the show's second season, "Ocupado," as Theresa. Mamrie also played a [[bisexual]] girl named Erin on General College, a non-profit TV show. In 2012, she performed live along the side of Steve Soroka in a sketch that they dubbed "Friends Without Benefits".{{Cite news|url=https://www.timeout.com/newyork/comedy/bof-friends-without-benefits-pose|title=BOF: Friends Without Benefits + POSE|work=Time Out New York|access-date=2018-02-21|language=en}} She was also involved in YouTube's Comedy Week program which began on May 19, 2013. On August 2, 2013 Hart announced on the main stage at [[VidCon]] 2013 that she would be starring in her first feature film alongside friends [[Grace Helbig]] and [[Hannah Hart]].{{cite web|last=Gutelle |first=Sam |url=http://www.tubefilter.com/2013/08/02/grace-helbig-hannah-mamrie-hart-chill-camp-takota/ |title=Grace Helbig, Hannah Hart, Mamrie Hart to Chill at 'Camp Takota' |publisher=Tubefilter.com |date=August 2, 2013 |accessdate=September 10, 2013}} Hart co-wrote the script with [[Lydia Genner]]. ''[[Camp Takota]]'' stars Helbig as a young woman who is forced to leave her big city job and head back to her old summer camp where she is reunited with old friends played by Hannah and Mamrie. The film, directed by Chris & Nick Riedell, began shooting in California on August 12, 2013.{{cite web|url=http://chill.com/camp |title=Camp Takota |publisher=Chill |date= |accessdate=September 10, 2013}} The film's official [[trailer (promotion)|trailer]] was released on December 24, 2013 on Hart's, Helbig's and Hannah's respective main YouTube channels, as well as on the film's official website.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=97aoiaWwRVk |title=The Official Camp Takota Trailer |publisher=YouTube |date=December 24, 2013 |accessdate=March 1, 2014}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=57ujbIxp954 |title=CAMP TAKOTA TRAILER – Harto Version |publisher=YouTube |date=December 24, 2013 |accessdate=March 1, 2014}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JwoClZPQgQw |title=Camp Takota's Trailer! I'm Freaking Out! |publisher=YouTube |date=December 24, 2013 |accessdate=March 1, 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://camptakota.com/ |title=Camp Takota |publisher=Camp Takota |date=February 14, 2014 |accessdate=March 1, 2014}} On February 5, 2014, an extended trailer was released on Helbig's ''it'sGrace'' channel and on the ''Camp Takota'' website {{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8gh9S9k3E9w |title=Camp Takota Official Extended Trailer |publisher=YouTube |date=February 5, 2014 |accessdate=March 1, 2014}} ''Camp Takota'' was released via digital download on February 14, 2014.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EWdvXeBk3-U#t=78 |title=Camp Takota Trailer: Redux |publisher=YouTube |date=January 14, 2014 |accessdate=March 1, 2014}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R02fZ2xXFE4#t=150 |title=CAMP TAKOTA RELEASE DATE ANNOUNCED!1! |publisher=YouTube |date=January 14, 2014 |accessdate=March 1, 2014}} Mamrie Hart had a recurring role in ''[[Oscar's Hotel for Fantastical Creatures]]'' where she portrayed a pink [[gigantic octopus]] named Octochef who is the titular hotel's residential chef.http://ew.com/article/2015/10/29/oscars-hotel-episodes/ Mamrie has had five appearances on [[Comedy Central]] quiz show ''[[@midnight]]''. She was the winner in Season 1 Episode 80 and Episode 171. Mamrie also appeared in the pilot episode of ''[[The Grace Helbig Show]]'' on E! on April 3, 2015.{{Cite web|url = http://newmediarockstars.com/2015/04/grace-helbig-show-premiere-shots-with-mamrie-hart-and-bringing-youtube-to-late-night/|title = Grace Helbig Show Premiere: Shots With Mamrie Hart and Bringing YouTube To Late Night|date = 2015-04-06|accessdate = 2015-04-09|website = New Media Rockstars|publisher = |last = DeSimone|first = Evan}} On October 28, 2015, Hart and her ''Camp Takota'' co-stars Grace Helbig and Hannah Hart announced pre-production on a new feature film titled ''[[Dirty 30 (film)|Dirty 30]]'', set for digital release September 23, 2016 .{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2015/digital/news/lionsgate-buys-dirty-thirty-comedy-with-youtube-stars-grace-helbig-mamrie-hart-and-hannah-hart-1201629006/|title=Lionsgate Buys 'Dirty Thirty' Comedy With YouTube Stars Grace Helbig, Mamrie Hart and Hannah Hart|work=Variety|accessdate=October 30, 2015}} === Books === ==== ''You Deserve a Drink: Boozy Misadventures and Tales of Debauchery'' ==== Hart landed a book deal with Plume Books in early January 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailydot.com/entertainment/mamrie-hart-youtube-memoir/ |title=YouTube's lovable lush Mamrie Hart drinks her way to a book deal |publisher=Daily Dot |date=January 23, 2014 |accessdate=May 19, 2014}} The book, titled ''[[You Deserve a Drink (book)|You Deserve a Drink: Boozy Misadventures and Tales of Debauchery]]'' was released on May 26, 2015.{{cite web|last1=Stinchecombe|first1=Colleen|title=Mamrie Hart's new memoir is a hilarious lesson in radical self-acceptance|url=http://www.sheknows.com/entertainment/articles/1084050/you-deserve-a-drink-is-a-book-about-radical-self-acceptance|publisher=She Knows|accessdate=4 June 2015}} About her book, Hart said:
Each chapter will have its own recipe, so in an ideal world, when you are reading about that time I fell in love with the half-snake, half-man guy and ran off with him to work in the carnival for a summer, you will make the cotton candy martini to drink while you read. Side note: That isn't actually one of my stories. The half-snake, half-man guy was way too good for me.
As to the style, she stated:
My whole brand of humor is self-deprecation — about owning your flaws and saying 'Fuck you' to anyone who doesn't like it," she says. "Hopefully that feeling will come across in [this book]. To where if you have a really embarrassing story, embrace it... Every story that I'll tell will lead up to why I am why I am.{{cite web|url=http://www.thevideoink.com/breaking-news/mamrie-hart-bring-boozy-memoir-deserve-drink-fans-2015-exclusive/#.U3orBVhdWwg |title=Exclusive: Mamrie Hart to Bring Boozy Memoir ‘You Deserve a Drink’ to Fans in 2015 |publisher=VideoInk |date=January 21, 2014 |accessdate=May 19, 2014}}
==== ''I've Got This Round: More Tales of Debauchery'' ==== Hart's second book, ''I've Got This Round: More Tales of Debauchery'', was released on February 6, 2018.{{Cite web|url=https://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/books/538766/ive-got-this-round-by-mamrie-hart/|title=I've Got This Round|last=|first=|date=|website=penguinrandomhouse.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=February 3, 2018}} She launched a U.S. tour for the release in February, 2018.{{Cite web|url=https://www.mamriebook.com/|title=Meet Mamrie on Tour|last=|first=|date=|website=mamriebook.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=February 3, 2018}} === Web Summit === In 2016 Mamrie Hart moderated a panel, which included [[Jake Paul]] and [[Alfie Deyes]], on the legacy of social media for [[Web Summit]] in [[Lisbon]], Portugal.{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I4S5wvnxXYA|title=The legacy of social media - Alfie Deyes, Jake Paul and Mamrie Hart at Web Summit 2016|last=|first=|date=|website=youtube.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=August 2, 2018}} ==References== {{reflist|35em}} ==External links== * {{IMDb name|nm4413917}} * {{YouTube|u=YouDeserveADrink|{{PAGENAMEBASE}}}} {{Streamy Awards Acting Performance Winners}} {{Use mdy dates|date=November 2014}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hart, Mamrie}} [[Category:1983 births]] [[Category:Actresses from North Carolina]] [[Category:American actresses]] [[Category:American memoirists]] [[Category:American women writers]] [[Category:American YouTubers]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Dover, New Jersey]] [[Category:People from Yadkin County, North Carolina]] [[Category:Streamy Award winners]] [[Category:University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill alumni]]
